# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function to achieve this:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), ' ', '_'), '-', '_')
end
```
This function firstly removes any leading or trailing whitespaces with `strip`, then makes the string lower case with `lowercase`. After that, it replaces all spaces and hyphens with an underscore using `replace` twice. The first `replace` call changes all spaces to underscores, while the second call changes any remaining hyphens to underscores too.
